sponsor: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston
briefTitle: Effectiveness of Higher Aspirin Dosing for Prevention of Preeclampsia in High Risk Obese Gravida
officialTitle: Effectiveness of Higher Aspirin Dosing for Prevention of Preeclampsia in High Risk Obese Gravida: An Open Label, Comparative Effectiveness, Randomized Controlled Trial (ASPREO Trial)
summary: To compare the incidence of preeclampsia in obese pregnant women (BMI greater than 30) with a singleton gestation at less than 20 weeks and either a history of preeclampsia in a prior pregnancy or stage I hypertension or pre-gestational diabetes who are randomized to either 81mg/day aspirin or 162mg/day aspirin.

primaryOutcome.measure: Number of Participants With Preeclampsia Diagnosis With Severe Features Based on Clinician Diagnosis
